results.firPara: The Football Association has confirmed that Paul Pogba will miss Manchester Uniteds opening day fixture against Bournemouth on Sunday because he is suspended.
results.secPara: The France midfielder, who became the most expensive player in history last week when he completed his move to Old Trafford for £93.2m, was included on a list of names who are banned for the first round of fixtures in the Premier League when it was published on Friday.
results.webTitle: FA confirms Paul Pogba suspended for Bournemouth v Manchester United

results.firPara: The workaholic young Bournemouth manager will hope his stock can rise even higher and more near-miracles can be achieved as his humble side strive to avoid second-season syndrome
results.secPara: There is only one moment when Eddie Howe seems a little unsure about the right thing to say and that is when the question is put to him of what he would have done had the team of Football Association headhunters looking for Englands next manager dialled his number.
results.webTitle: Eddie Howe: ‘I’d love the chance … I was honoured to be linked with England job’

results.firPara: The Sunderland defender Lamine Koné has submitted a transfer request after the clubs promised offer of an improved contract failed to materialise.
results.secPara: The Ivory Coast defender, who was signed from the French side Lorient in January for around £5m, was the subject of a £17m bid from Everton last week. Koné still has four years left to run on the deal he signed seven months ago but released a statement on Thursday which claimed he had been assured they would renegotiate after surviving relegation last season.
results.webTitle: Sunderland’s Lamine Koné submits transfer request after Everton bid

results.firPara: Nice football club will wear a special kit to honour the victims of the Nice terror attack last month in their Ligue 1 season opener against Rennes on Sunday.
results.secPara: Eighty-five people were killed and 307 injured on 14 July when a cargo truck ploughed into crowds celebrating Bastille Day on Nices Promenade des Anglais. The attack was the worst terror attack in France since last Novembers Paris attacks.
results.webTitle: Nice football club to honour 85 victims of terror attack with commemorative shirt
